<misra_rule>
MISRA C 2023 Rule 17.8 is: A function parameter should not be modified.
Note that the object referred to by a pointer parameter may be modified, but the pointer itself shall not be modified.
</misra_rule>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- is_rule_violated: whether the rule is violated or not (true/false),
- scenario: a specific violation scenario.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of MHD_SHA512_256_update:
```c
void
MHD_SHA512_256_update (struct Sha512_256Ctx *ctx,
                       const uint8_t *data,
                       size_t length)
{
  unsigned int bytes_have; /**< Number of bytes in the context buffer */
  uint64_t count_hi; /**< The high part to be moved to another variable */

  mhd_assert ((data != NULL) || (length == 0));

#ifndef MHD_FAVOR_SMALL_CODE
  if (0 == length)
    return; /* Shortcut, do nothing */
#endif /* ! MHD_FAVOR_SMALL_CODE */

  /* Note: (count & (SHA512_256_BLOCK_SIZE-1))
           equals (count % SHA512_256_BLOCK_SIZE) for this block size. */
  bytes_have = (unsigned int) (ctx->count & (SHA512_256_BLOCK_SIZE - 1));
  ctx->count += length;
#if SIZEOF_SIZE_T > 7
  if (length > ctx->count)
    ctx->count_bits_hi += 1U << 3; /* Value wrap */
#endif /* SIZEOF_SIZE_T > 7 */
  count_hi = ctx->count >> 61;
  if (0 != count_hi)
  {
    ctx->count_bits_hi += count_hi;
    ctx->count &= UINT64_C (0x1FFFFFFFFFFFFFFF);
  }

  if (0 != bytes_have)
  {
    unsigned int bytes_left = SHA512_256_BLOCK_SIZE - bytes_have;
    if (length >= bytes_left)
    {     /* Combine new data with data in the buffer and
             process the full block. */
      memcpy (((uint8_t *) ctx->buffer) + bytes_have,
              data,
              bytes_left);
      data += bytes_left;
      length -= bytes_left;
      sha512_256_transform (ctx->H, ctx->buffer);
      bytes_have = 0;
    }
  }

  while (SHA512_256_BLOCK_SIZE <= length)
  {   /* Process any full blocks of new data directly,
         without copying to the buffer. */
    sha512_256_transform (ctx->H, data);
    data += SHA512_256_BLOCK_SIZE;
    length -= SHA512_256_BLOCK_SIZE;
  }

  if (0 != length)
  {   /* Copy incomplete block of new data (if any)
         to the buffer. */
    memcpy (((uint8_t *) ctx->buffer) + bytes_have, data, length);
  }
}
```
</target_code>
<target_code>
Here is the code fragment that you need to analyze:
```c
length -= bytes_left;
```
Focus on the above code fragment and judge whether it violates the rule 17.8 or not.
</target_code>
scenario: The statement 'length -= bytes_left;' modifies the formal parameter 'length' (a size_t function parameter). MISRA C 2023 Rule 17.8 states that a function parameter should not be modified, so decrementing the parameter inside the function violates the rule. (Compliant code should use a local copy—e.g. 'size_t rem = length'—and modify that.)
